AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that convicted Maria De Jesus Garcia and heard her appeal regarding an unconstitutional stop and search of a pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in border surveillance, with agents making stops based on reasonable suspicion, utilizing specialized experience and training to assess smuggling routes and vehicles, including the use of marked sedans for observations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: appellate court reviewing cases related to border patrol stops and reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: a court case involving a pickup truck camper and suspicious passenger behavior, resulting in a guilty verdict and an appeal regarding the stop's constitutionality
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographic boundary relevant to immigration and smuggling cases
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where stops and searches may occur, commonly used for smuggling of aliens, with agents observing vehicle behavior such as slow speed and heavy loading
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: a court case where the stop was deemed insufficient due to passengers sitting low
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: a court case with similar testimony regarding passenger conduct
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: a court case where the circumstance of passengers slouching down was not considered sufficient for a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the court is located and the case was heard, referenced in a court case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce standard: a legal standard guiding reasonable suspicion for investigatory stops near the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S.-Mexican border: an international border relevant to immigration and smuggling cases
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: appellate court making decisions regarding the justification of investigatory stops based on factors such as vehicle loading
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in a legal case involving a challenge to the modified Allen charge given to the jury and a request for post-verdict discovery, convicted of aiding and abetting the transportation of undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: border patrol agent involved in the stop and search of a pickup truck camper, providing expertise in distinguishing between characteristics of travelers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski: border patrol agent involved in the stop and search of a pickup truck camper, providing expertise in distinguishing between characteristics of travelers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Brignoni-Ponce: a court case referenced for distinguishing suspicious behavior in the context of border patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol as Stanley P: border patrol agents involved in stops and searches, with expertise in distinguishing between characteristics of travelers who are illegal aliens and those lawfully present in the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the majority of the court: appellate court making decisions regarding the justification of investigatory stops based on factors such as vehicle loading
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol as the borde: border patrol agent involved in stops and searches, with expertise in distinguishing between characteristics of travelers who are illegal aliens and those lawfully present in the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol as the marke: vehicle used by border patrol agents during stops and searches
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron's ex: expertise of border patrol agents in distinguishing between characteristics of travelers who are illegal aliens and those lawfully present in the United States
